prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Long, Thin, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** The first part of the CAD model is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This part will serve as the base for subsequent parts. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The euler angles for the coordinate system are: - X-axis: -90.0 degrees - Y-axis: 0.0 degrees - Z-axis: -90.0 degrees The translation vector for the coordinate system is: - X: 0.0 - Y: 0.0 - Z: 0.0 2. **Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane.** The sketch consists of one face (face_1), which contains one loop (loop_1). Loop_1 consists of six lines (line_1 through line_6). - line_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.0339, 0.0) - line_2: Start Point (0.0339, 0.0), End Point (0.0339, 0.0339) - line_3: Start Point (0.0339, 0.0339), End Point (0.0319, 0.0339) - line_4: Start Point (0.0319, 0.0339), End Point (0.0319, 0.002) - line_5: Start Point (0.0319, 0.002), End Point (0.0, 0.002) - line_6: Start Point (0.0, 0.002), End Point (0.0, 0.0) 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.0339. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** The euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system will be used to transform the sketch. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.75 units, and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0 units. The sketch scaling parameter is 0.0339. This operation results in the creation of a new solid body. The dimensions of the prism are: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0339 - Height: 0.0339</description>
